title: [Self-directed] Kinematic Organization Analysis of Cricket Batters: A Scientific Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic physics concepts (motion, velocity, angles) and sports observation experience
context.additional_context: Students understand basic cricket rules and have access to video analysis and simple experimental tools

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three differences in batter movement patterns under experimental conditions (live pitching, machine pitching, video simulation).
Learners can graphically represent the correlation between movement initiation delay time and reduction in ball exit velocity.
Learners can compare differences in information utilization between video simulation and actual game conditions and write an explanatory report.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
